params.note: long-term culture of iNPCs leads to decreased PAX2 expression, but does not impair nephron organoid differentiation; PAX8 may compensate; iNPC model has limitations for studying PAX2-related kidney diseases.
iNPC-derived nephron organoids show 0.67% off-target cells by single-cell multiome analysis; podocytes dominate (70–90%), tubules are minor (10–30%); bias is intrinsic and evident across passages.

Current iNPC-derived nephron organoids have limited nephron patterning, immature tubules (lack transporter expression like organic anion/cation transporters and UMOD), and lack key cell types (e.g., SLC12A3+ distal convoluted tubule, collecting duct, stroma, vasculature, neuronal systems).
hPSCs are maintained in mTeSR Plus medium (Steps 1–9); routine mycoplasma testing performed; plates coated with Matrigel or alternatives.
hPSCs are differentiated into iNPCs via three-stage protocol over 10 days (Steps 10–30).
For hPSC lines with NPC reporter (e.g., SIX2-GFP;PAX2-mCherry), iNPCs are purified by FACS (Step 31A).
For hPSC lines without NPC reporter, iNPCs are enriched by culturing in hNPSR-v2 medium over passages (Step 31B).
For hPSC lines without NPC reporter and high off-target cells, iNPCs are enriched using ITGA8 surface marker (Step 31C).
Purified or enriched iNPCs are cultured stably in hNPSR-v2 medium for expansion (Steps 32–41).
iNPCs can be cryopreserved for long-term storage (Steps 42–44).
iNPC identity and purity are verified by immunostaining every 4–5 passages (2–3 weeks) (Steps 45–52).
iNPCs differentiate into nephron organoids in a six-well Transwell plate over 21 days in three phases (Steps 53–64).
